White chose to play along the lines of the Grand Prix Attack: Black is already running behind in tempo...
moves.7... Nbc6 8. d3 b5 9. Be3 d6 10. Qc2 a6: White has finished the opening: at least two tempi ahead...
waiting for an oppurtunity to play Rd1...
moves.18... exf4 19. Bxf4 Nd3 20. Rfd1: the sharpest: the Queen sacrifice is correct; after Qxb5?, Nxf4, gxf4, Bc6, Qc4, Bb5, spells a lot of trouble for White...
moves.20... Bxe4 21. Bxb8 Bxf3 22. Bxf3 Qxb8 2: forcing Nf2+: after Qf2, just Rxd3... should Black continue with Qxb2, Rad1, and all is finished for Black...
securing a better position: after Qxc5, Nxc5, Bxb2, Nd7, White is winning...
moves.27... Qa7: a bit of a stain, on this otherwise flawless game: Black resigned on the spot...
